definitions.definition: ( nautical ) The rigging of a sailing ship or other such craft .
Special equipment or gear used for a particular purpose.
examples: The climbers each had a different rig for climbing that particular rockface.

definitions.definition: ( US ) A large truck , especially a semi-trailer truck .
examples: Every rig at the truckstop had custom-made mud-flaps.

definitions.definition: The special apparatus used for drilling wells.
( informal ) A costume or an outfit .
examples: My sister and I always made our own rigs for Halloween.

definitions.definition: ( slang , computing ) A personal computer , typically one modified for looks .
An imperfectly castrated horse , sheep etc.
( slang ) Radio equipment, especially a citizen's band transceiver .
( slang ) Equipment used for taking recreational drugs .
( animation ) A model outfitted with parameterized controls for animation.

main_definition: ( nautical ) The rigging of a sailing ship or other such craft .

definitions.definition: ( Northern England , Scotland , dialect ) A ridge .

main_definition: ( Northern England , Scotland , dialect ) A ridge .

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) A wanton ; one given to unbecoming conduct.
( obsolete ) A sportive or unbecoming trick; a frolic .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) A wanton ; one given to unbecoming conduct.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) A sportive or unbecoming trick; a frolic .

definitions.definition: An algebraic structure similar to a ring , but without the requirement that every element have an additive inverse .

main_definition: ( algebra , ring theory ) An algebraic structure similar to a ring , but without the requirement that every element have an additive inverse .
